image.caption: Image courtesy of the Library of Congress
image.name: K000096_001

profileText: A Representative from Iowa; born on a farm near Greenville, Lucas County, Iowa, March 17, 1868; attended the rural schools; studied law; was admitted to the bar in 1887 and commenced practice in Albia, Monroe County, Iowa, in 1889; city attorney 1890-1892; prosecuting attorney of Monroe County, Iowa, 1893-1897; member of the State house of representatives 1899-1909 and served as speaker in 1909; elected as a Republican to the Sixty-first and Sixty-second Congresses (March 4, 1909-March 3, 1913); was not a candidate for renomination in 1912 to the Sixty-third Congress; resumed the practice of law in Albia, Iowa; moved to Des Moines, Iowa, in 1921; Governor of Iowa 1921-1925; resided in Des Moines, Iowa, until his death on November 5, 1936; remains were cremated and the ashes interred on the lawn of ``Kendall Place,'' his former home in Albia, Iowa.

asset.name: K000096_001

researchRecord.name: 1907-1923, 2 folders.
researchRecord.description: Collection contains addresses, speeches, letters, and memorabilia. There is also one letter in the Alonzo Abernethy collection.

researchRecord.name: In the papers of William Francis Riley, 1932-1957, 6 linear feet.
